title: How to Select and Store Snow Peas

steps.headline: Purchase snow peas that have a fresh, green top.
steps.description: The green should be bright and the seeds very small and flat.

steps.headline: Test them for the "snap" factor.
steps.description: Good snow peas should snap when broken in half.

steps.headline: Check the length.
steps.description: The ideal length for a snow pea is approximately 7.5cm/3" in length and about 2cm/3/4" across.

steps.headline: Look for smooth, unbroken skin.
steps.description: Avoid snow peas with wilted, discoloured or shrivelled parts.

steps.headline: Wash snow peas prior to storage.
steps.description: Allow them to dry on a wire rack and place in a paper bag for storage.

steps.headline: Store in the vegetable crisper in the refrigerator.
steps.description: Kept this way, they should last for up to three weeks.
